page.title: 07Transport
page.content: If you live in a small village you really need to have your own transport.Some villages have no bus service at all.There is a bus which goes to Bridgwater twice a week via Burrowbridge and Moorland.Most families have at least one car.Young people learn to drive as soon as they are old enough.Some of them start off on motor bikes or scooters until they are old enough to drive a car. People use their cars for shopping,going to work,taking children to school,visiting the doctor or dentist and for outings. People who have not got cars have to walk or cycle or ask other people to give them a lift.It is very expensive to have a taxi. Everyone should drive very carefully on country roads because there are no pavements.
